Week of December 8, 2014 <http://blog.pivotal.io/cloud-foundry-pivotal/news-2/governance-by-contribution-and-the-cloud-foundry-foundation> CLOUD FOUNDRY FOUNDATION LAUNCH: GOVERNANCE BY CONTRIBUTION AND THE CLOUD FOUNDRY FOUNDATION Read <http://blog.pivotal.io/cloud-foundry-pivotal/news-2/governance-by-contribution-and-the-cloud-foundry-foundation> Paul Maritz's blog on the official launch of the Cloud Foundry Foundation.
A group of companies, most of which have considerable experience in the good and the bad of open source, have come together to define a model of governance which is designed to allow broad participation and experimentation. Driving this approach is the principle of “governance by contribution” – a path to allow those who wish to meaningfully contribute, and exhibit real understanding, to earn the right to control the evolution. READ MORE <http://blog.pivotal.io/cloud-foundry-pivotal/news-2/governance-by-contribution-and-the-cloud-foundry-foundation> EPISODE #10: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 7TH <http://pivotal.io/podcasts> Join us <http://www.pivotal.io/podcasts> this week for 'Using Pivotal CF for Blue/Green Deployment', Episode #9 of our ongoing podcast series.
Getting new features into the hands of your customers sounds great, but it can be a little trickier than it looks. How do you ensure that a change does not “break” the system? How do you roll-back if something bad happens? How do you deploy a change so that no traffic is lost, packets are dropped or transactions missed?
Fortunately Pivotal CF provides built-in capability to handle this complexity for you. In this episode, we will dive more deeply into the concept of Blue/Green deployments, and the mechanism used by Pivotal CF to deploy changes into production with zero downtime and no packets dropped! SUBSCRIBE <http://www.pivotal.io/podcasts> TWITTER NLP EXAMPLE: HOW TO SCALE PART-OF-SPEECH TAGGING WITH MPP (PART 1) <http://blog.pivotal.io/pivotal/products/twitter-nlp-example-how-to-scale-part-of-speech-tagging-with-mpp-part-2> In this two-part series, one of Pivotal’s Senior Data Scientists provides an overview of how to achieve part-of-speech tagging on tweets at scale. In this second part of the series, using code examples, we dive deeper into PL/Java UDFs and write a wrapper on ArkTweetNLP to perform POS tagging at scale with Pivotal’s MPP data platform.

Teams tasked with building or evolving a company’s mobile app strategy should heed tips and best practices, like those in Pivotal's infographic. In this post, Pivotal covers the top three ways to up your mobile game.
